member.name: T:Newtera.Common.MetaData.DataView.Taxonomy.TaxonomyModel
member.summary:
A TaxonomyModel contains a taxonomy tree that provided a logical classification scheme.
A TaxonomyModel is used in two areas: to generate queries that fetches data instances that satisfy the definition of taxonomy nodes, and to provide information for user interface creation.
A TaxonomyModel can be constructed programatically or from an XML data. It can be saved as an XML data too.
member.author: Yong Zhang
member.remarks:
A non-leaf node in a taxonomy tree can be just a place holder to provide a navigation path to its subnodes. This kind of node is called dummy node. A dummy node does not have either class name, data view name, or search filter specified. Leaf nodes can not be dummy nodes. For a non-root node with class name or data view name defined, if its parent node is associated a class, the class name itself or the base class of the data view must be one of subclasses of the class associated with parent node. A node in taxonomy tree can add a search filter to the data view inherited from parent node or created locally to define the set of instances associated with the node.
If a node has a class name, but not data view name, the default data view of the class is used. Othewise, the specified data view is used.

member.name: T:Newtera.Common.MetaData.DataView.DataViewModel
member.summary:
A DataViewModel is an object-representation of a specific data view on the instance data of a class. It includes a base class, a set of referenced classes, search filters, and a set of attributes to be shown in the view.
A DataViewModel is used in two areas: to generate an XQuery to fetch the data from database, and to provide information for user interface creation.
A DataViewModel can be constructed programatically or from an XML data. It can be saved as an XML data too.
member.author: Yong Zhang

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.Mappings.ClassMapping.Transform(System.Data.DataSet,System.Data.DataSet,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Transform data from source format to destination format according to the class mappings.
member.param: The DataSet for the source data
The DataSet containing the transformed data.
member.remarks: The method will write the transformed data into the corresponding DataTable instance(s) in destinationDataSet.

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.Mappings.ClassMapping.Select(System.Data.DataSet,System.Data.DataSet,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Select data from source instances and copy them to an destination instance according to the class mappings.
member.param: The DataSet for the source data
The DataSet containing the transformed data.
member.remarks: This method is used by Selector. It will create an new row to destination DataTable only once to store the selected data from multiple instances in the source DataSet for a certain class. For simple attribute in destination row, the value is override by each iteration; for array attribute in destination row, a new row is added to the array value by each iteration.

member.returns: A DefaultValue instance, null if no DefaultValue instance with the given name.

member.remarks: Example of simple attributes in xml schema

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.Schema.ArrayAttributeElement.Marshal
member.summary: Write objects to XML Schema Model
member.remarks: Notice that we write physical value of a member to xml schema. For example, _isUnique member holds a physical value, but IsUnique property holds logical value. Logical value may be different from physical value. When an attribute is a primary key, even _isUnique member holds a physical value of false, IsUnique property will return true. Therefore, make sure that only physical values get written to xml schema. The same is true when reading value from a xml schema in Unmarshal process.

member.name: T:Newtera.Common.MetaData.Schema.SchemaModel
member.summary:
A SchemaModel represents a particular Object-relational schema that simplies the modelling of business problems in certain areas.
You can create a SchemaModel in two ways. One is to create it from scratch using the SchemaModel API. The SchemaModel provides a set of classes and methods to allow creation, deletion, and modification of a schema model that consists of some logical entities, such as Class, SimpleAttribute, RelationshipAttribute Constraints. Then the SchemaModel can be saved as XML Schema. Alternatively, a SchemaModel can be generated from a saved XML Schema, be modified, and be saved as XML Schema again.
member.author: Yong Zhang
member.remarks: Microsoft's SOM (Schema Object Model) as internal representation of XML schema is used for internal structuring.

member.summary: Create the member objects from a XML Schema Model

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.Schema.SimpleAttributeElement.Marshal
member.summary: Write objects to XML Schema Model
member.remarks: Notice that we write physical value of a member to xml schema. For example, _isUnique member holds a physical value, but IsUnique property holds logical value. Logical value may be different from physical value. When an attribute is a primary key, even _isUnique member holds a physical value of false, IsUnique property will return true. Therefore, make sure that only physical values get written to xml schema. The same is true when reading value from a xml schema in Unmarshal process.

member.name: T:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher
member.summary: The class implements the matching algorithm. The algorithm is to find applicable rules that match a given access request. And it doesn't concern about conflict rules, but simply finds all rules that are matched.
member.author: Yong Zhang

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher.#ctor
member.summary: Initiate an instance of RuleMatcher class.

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher.Match(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.AccessRequest,Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclPolicy,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Match an access request with rules and return a list of decision of the matched rules.
member.param: If true, executing condition; otherwise, condition always is true.
member.returns: A list of decisions of the rules that match the access request.

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher.GetMatchedRules(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclRuleCollection,Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.AccessRequest,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the rules that match the criteria specified in an access request.
member.param: A collection of rules to match against
true to check the condition, false otherwise.
member.returns: A collection of matched rules

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher.IsMatched(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclRule,Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.AccessRequest,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the information indicating whether a rule matchs the criteria specified in an access request. A rule is considered to be matched if rule's subject and condition (if required) match that of an access request.
member.param: true to check the condition, false otherwise.
member.returns: true if the rule is matched, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher.IsSubjectMatched(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclSubject,Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclSubject)
member.summary: Gets the information indicating whether the subject of an access request matches that of a rule.
member.param: The subject of an access request.
member.returns: True if subjects are matched, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher.IsUidMatched(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the information indicating whether the Uid of an access request subject matches that of a rule subject
member.param: The uid of an access request.
member.returns: true if the uid is matched, false otherwise.
member.remarks: If the rule does not have a UID, it is considered to be matched

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher.IsGroupMatched(System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Gets the information indicating whether groups of a rule and an access request are matched.
member.returns: true if groups are matched; false, otherwise.
member.remarks: If the rule's groups are subset of access request, it is considered as being matched. If the rule doesn't have a group, it is considered being matched

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher.IsRoleMatched(System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Gets the information indicating whether roles of a rule and an access request are matched.
member.returns: true if roles are matched; false, otherwise.
member.remarks: If rule's roles is a subset of that of the access request, it is considered to be matched.

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher.Contains(System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Gets the information indicating whether a string array contains another string array
member.returns: true if the first string array contains the second string array

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.Processor.RuleMatcher.IsConditionMatched(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclRule)
member.summary: Gets the information indicating whether the condition of a rule meets the current context.
member.returns: if matching, return true; otherwise return false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the runner object that is responsible for running the rules' conditions expressed in xquery

member.summary: Initiate an instance of XaclPolicy class

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclPolicy.GetRules(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclObject)
member.summary: Gets the rules, including the inherited ones, for an XaclObject
member.returns: A collection of XaclRule instances

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclPolicy.GetLocalRules(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclObject)
member.summary: Gets the rules (not including the inherited ones) for an XaclObject
member.returns: A collection of XaclRule instances

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclPolicy.IsRuleExist(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclObject,Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclRule)
member.summary: Gets the information indicating whether a rule for an XaclObject with the same subject has already existed.
member.returns: true if it exists, false otherwise.
member.remarks: If a rule with the same subject exists in the local XaclDef instance, then this method will return true. If an inherited rule from the parent XaclDef instances with the same subject exists, this method will return true as well

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclPolicy.IsLocalRuleExist(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclObject,Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclRule)
member.summary: Gets the information indicating whether a local rule for an XaclObject with the same subject has already existed.
member.returns: true if it exists, false otherwise.
member.remarks: If a rule with the same subject exists in the local XaclDef instance, then this method will return true. It won't search up for the propagated rules

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclPolicy.GetPropagatedRule(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclObject,Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclRule)
member.summary: Gets the most immediate propagated rule of a given local rule.
member.returns: A XaclRule object, null if there is none
member.remarks: A propagated rule is the one in the path of the given XaclObject and has AllowPropagate set to true.

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclPolicy.AddRule(Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclObject,Newtera.Common.MetaData.XaclModel.XaclRule)

member.summary: Remove a rule for an XaclObject from a ploicy

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.MetaDataModel.GetDefaultDataView(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the default data view of a class, including only attributes whose usage is defined as "either Result, Serach, or Both"
member.returns: The DataViewModel for the default view
member.remarks: The default data view consists of all the attributes in search and result fields, including simple and relationship ones, that an user has permission to access. The search fields are combinded with AND operator by default.

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.MetaDataModel.GetDefaultDataView(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the default data view of a class
member.param: A string of sections separated by ;
member.returns: The DataViewModel for the default view
member.remarks: The default data view consists of the attributes in search and result fields, including simple and relationship ones, that an user has permission to access. The search fields are combinded with AND operator by default. If a section string is provided, only those attributes that matches any of sections will be added to the result list.

member.name: M:Newtera.Common.MetaData.MetaDataModel.GetDefaultDataView(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the default data view of a class
member.param: true to include array attributes, false otherwise.
member.returns: The DataViewModel for the default view
member.remarks: The default data view consists of the attributes in search and result fields, including simple and relationship ones, that an user has permission to access. The search fields are combinded with AND operator by default. If a section string is provided, only those attributes that matches any of sections will be added to the result list.
